document_data.mainbody:
Lathins Cut was a short, hard-packed dirt and gravel paved, alleyway in the Trades Ward of Waterdeep.
This alleyway ran in a straight line west from the High Road, cutting through Jembril Street, and ended on the west side of Burdag Lane.
Lathins Cut was named after the man who had his own home leveled, upon his death, to create the empty space the alleyway occupied as he wished to make it easier for the devout to reach the Plinth.
The Plinth An all-faiths temple and the only temple in all of the Trades Ward.
Lathins Cut was considered by locals to be a landmark. Both they and visitors to Waterdeep often rendezvoused at the alley.
